list-item.p: What are the major and emerging vectors and pathways, such as changing trade patterns, by which invasive alien species could enter or spread within the UK?
What are the current propagule/colonisation pressure patterns of invasive alien species in the UK?
What are the biological security risks from importing soil (including rooted plants)?
Are there differences in range shifts under climate change between native and invasive alien species?
How can climate change mitigation policies (e.g. water transfers, changes in crops, biofuels, re-forestation) promote or retard invasive alien species?
What is the invasion debt (i.e. established invasive alien species yet to exert impact) in the UK and how does this vary regionally?
What are the social/cultural impacts of invasive alien species?
What risk do invasive animal and plant species pose in terms of parasite/pathogen introduction and transmission?
How effective has biological security been in preventing biological invasions in other countries and how can we translate effective practice to a UK context?
What has been the success of horizon scanning activities for predicting and managing invasive alien species?
How well are the UK Overseas Territories managing the impact of invasive alien species and controlling the risks of further invasive alien species?
How can citizen science be improved as a method of surveillance and monitoring invasive alien species?
What new policy options are required to reduce risks from the widespread distribution of organisms via internet sales?
What determines the optimal allocation of resources in (i) preventing entry, (ii) early identification and eradication, (iii) controlling and (iv) mitigating impacts of invasive alien species?
Which management practices for invasive alien species (e.g. culling, quarantine, chemical control, biological control, genetic control) are most acceptable to different groups of stakeholders?
